qas.question: Which Nigerian leader decided Nigeria would return to democracy in 1990?
What did Babangida set up to help pay Nigeria's national debt?

answers.text: International Monetary Fund's Structural Adjustment Program

qas.question: What was most of Nigeria's federal income being spent on?
What controversial religious group did Nigeria join?

context: The new head of state, <a0_0>Ibrahim Babangida<a0_0/>, declared himself president and commander in chief of the armed forces and the ruling Supreme Military Council. He set 1990 as the official deadline for a return to democratic governance. Babangida's tenure was marked by a flurry of political activity: he instituted the <a1_0>International Monetary Fund's Structural Adjustment Program<a1_0/> (SAP) to aid in the repayment of the country's crushing international <a2_0>debt<a2_0/>, which most federal revenue was dedicated to servicing. He enrolled Nigeria in the <a3_0>Organisation of the Islamic Conference<a3_0/>, which aggravated religious tensions in the country.
